page.title: 09Smuggling in Nanjizel.
page.content: It was a dark dim night with a little bit of mist, perfect for smuggling. We turned the engine off and anchored. Then we rowed ashore hoping there were no custom men about. We are smuggling champayne. We had a 100,000 bottles of it. We were glad the cove was rocky because we did not want anybody to see us. In the morning we sold 25,000 bottles of it in the market. Then we decided to go back to our hide-out to get some more champayne. The next day we sold 65,000 bottles for Â£100,000 the champayne that was left we drunk our selves and got drunk. This time we were lucky, but it is dangerous being a smuggler, it is only the chance of big money that makes us do it at all. We do not get into smuggling drugs because that can harm others but there is no harm in a bottle of champayne.
